|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),NAND,Compact Flash --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Macronix;MX29LV320CBTC-90G; |flash1size = 4 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4 --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 16 |ram1chip = EtronTech;EM639165TS-6G; |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->

}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== OEM Gemtek WRTO-127G (WRTO-127G_V03) :"190-D03-6900R RoHS" is silkscreened on the board.
The device has been tagged with the AGN100 wireless module FCC ID.. but the only FCC ID printed on the unit is SA3-AGN0901AP0100. SA3-AGN0901AP0100 defines the board used in the [[Belkin F5D8230-4 v1]] which is not used in the v3.. so the FCC ID printed on the label is incorrect.
The RF shields are attached to the main board with a combination of blue clips and adhesive tape. The Airgo wireless module is soldered onto the Mini PCI retaining clips.
The default SSID is '''Belkin_Pre-N_XXXXXX''' where '''XXXXXX''' appears to be the last three octets of the wireless interface MAC address (lower case letters).
